questions.question: The quantity that is measured by a polarimeter is,
Specific rotation of an optically active compound is

answers.a: The optical rotation at specific chiral centre
answers.c: Optical rotation at unit length and unit concentration
answers.d: Optical illusion of pure chiral solution

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement?

answers.a: Chiral molecules will rotate polarized light in a clockwise direction, termed dextrorotatory, and its mirror-image partner in a counter-clockwise termed levorotatory
answers.b: Chiral molecules will rotate polarized light in a clockwise direction, termed levorotatory, and its mirror-image partner in a counter-clockwise termed dextrorotatory
answers.c: Chiral molecules will rotate polarized light in a counter-clockwise direction, termed dextrorotatory, and its mirror-image partner in a clockwise termed levorotatory
answers.d: None of the options is true

questions.question: Polarimeter works on the principle of which of the following?

answers.a: Change in the flow of liquids
answers.b: Change in the electrical conductivity of solution with concentration

questions.question: Which of the following most accurate about a plane polarised light?

answers.a: As it propagate, both magnitude of electric vector and direction of polarisation varies
answers.b: As it propagate, neither magnitude nor direction of electric vector varies
answers.c: As it propagate, magnitude of electric vector varies periodically but direction of polarisation remains unchanged
answers.d: Change in orientation of Nicol prism has no effect on direction of polarisation
